plugins.name: Better Title Case
plugins.description:
Not a fan of built-in Figma's title case? Better Title Case got your back!


  1. Select a frame or a group to apply Better Title Case to all text layers inside
  2. Or directly select one or several text layers to apply Better Title Case only to these layers


Safe to use on text layers that have several styles/properties applied to them â€” plugin will not remove bold or underlined text from your layers.


Current Capitalization Rules:

  1. UPPERCASE words are not processed, so AAPL or MBA will stay as is.
  2. The first and the last word in a sentence are always processed.
  3. There is a custom list of words that shouldnâ€™t be in converted to Title Case: and, as, but, for, if, nor, or, so, yet, a, an, the, as, at, by, for, in, of, off, on, per, to, up, via, vs, v, (vs.) (v.)
  4. Word after em dash and slash processed even if it's a minor word.


If you have any feedback or ideas on improving the plugin â€” feel free to reach out via email or in comment section ðŸ˜‰.

plugins.name: Icon Stitch
plugins.description:
Icon Stitch is a plugin for exporting icon sets as SVG sprites. It optimizes your icons for the web and exports them as a single file. Icon Stitch streamlines workflow by generating code for easy integration into your projects and is a time-saver tool for developers and designers who need to work with icons.


Key features:


- Create with a single click

- Optimize for performance and web

- Streamline your workflow with generated code

- Validate potential issues and resolve with ease

- Import SVG sprites to visualize file contents


The plugin contains paid features:


The free version allows you to create and export SVG sprites with up to 20 icons.

Consider upgrading to support development and lift the limit.


For technical support, feature requests, and general feedback, please create a new issue on the GitHub repository.


---

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.

plugins.name: Universal Design (beta)
plugins.description:
UDML Exporter for Figma (beta)


Transform your Figma designs into AI-ready UDML (Universal Design Markup Language) documents. UDML Exporter creates structured, semantic descriptions of your designs specifically optimized for AI interpretation and code generation.


AI-First Design Documentation


UDML is built from the ground up to be understood by AI. Instead of trying to directly convert designs to code (which often produces messy, unmaintainable results), UDML provides AI agents with:


  1. Semantic Structure: Clear representation of layout hierarchies and relationships
  2. Design Context: Comprehensive documentation of components and their usage
  3. Style System: Organized design tokens and variables
  4. Asset Catalog: Structured references to exported graphics and icons
  5. Rich Metadata: Layer names, descriptions, and relationships that AI can interpret


Why AI + UDML?


Traditional Figma-to-code tools try to guess what components you meant to create. UDML takes a different approach:


  1. Let AI Do the Heavy Lifting: Instead of making assumptions, provide AI with rich context
  2. Semantic Understanding: AI can interpret layer names and relationships to generate appropriate components
  3. Design System Integration: AI can map your design tokens to existing system variables
  4. Framework Flexibility: Generate code for any framework or library
  5. Open and Extensible: No locked-in formats or proprietary solutions


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma using Auto Layout and components
  2. Export to UDML (optimized for AI consumption)
  3. Provide the UDML to an AI agent (like Claude or Cursor)
  4. Get clean, semantic code that matches your design system


Example AI Interpretation


<!-- UDML Export -->
<column name="user-profile-card" gap="16px">
<image name="avatar" src="assets/user-avatar.png"/>
<text name="user-name" typography="heading-medium">John Doe</text>
<text name="user-title" typography="body-regular">Senior Designer</text>
</column>


AI might interpret this as:


<!-- React Interpretation -->
<UserCard>
<Avatar src={user.avatar} />
<Heading level={3}>{user.name}</Heading>
<Text>{user.title}</Text>
</UserCard>


Perfect For


  1. Designers who want AI to understand their work
  2. Developers who need intelligent code generation
  3. Teams building or maintaining design systems
  4. Anyone looking for an alternative to traditional Figma-to-code tools


Getting Started


  1. Install the plugin
  2. Design with AI interpretation in mind
  3. Export to UDML
  4. Let AI generate your code


Design for AI


To get the best results:

  1. Use clear, descriptive layer names
  2. Leverage Auto Layout for clear structure
  3. Create consistent component patterns
  4. Document your design system tokens


Join the AI-First Design Movement


UDML is an open specification for AI-friendly design documentation. Help shape the future of AI-assisted design-to-code workflows.


docs.universaldesign.ai
plugins.tagline: Figma to code, your way

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer for Figma


Plugin for finding and replacing text in layer and variable names, with automatic naming convention conversion.


Features


  1. Layer renaming: Quickly find and replace text in layer names
  2. Layer type filtering: frames, text, components, images, etc.
  3. Variable support: find and replace in variable names
  4. Flexible filtering options for variables: search by full name, path only, or name only
  5. Auto-renaming: Convert layer names to different naming conventions automatically
  6. Naming conventions: Support for camelCase, PascalCase, snake_case, kebab-case, flatcase, dotcase, and spacecase
  7. Live preview: See how names will look before applying changes
  8. Revert functionality: Restore original names after renaming
  9. Dot case support: Special support for CSS class-style naming with leading dots (.class-name)


How to use


For layers:


1. Select the "Layers" tab

2. Choose the layer types to search

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"

7. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


Auto-renaming:


1. Select the "Auto" tab

2. Choose the layer types to rename

3. Select the desired naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, etc.)

4. See the live preview of how names will be converted

5. Click "Rename" to apply the changes

6. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


For variables:


1. Select the "Variables" tab

2. Choose the search filter:

- All - search the entire variable name

- Path - search only in the path (all parts before the last "/")

- Name - search only in the name (part after the last "/")

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"


Troubleshooting


If the plugin cannot find variables:

1. Make sure there are variables in the file

2. Check that variables are available on the current page

3. Try restarting the plugin

4. Ensure that your Figma version supports variables


If auto-renaming doesn't work as expected:

1. Note that auto-renaming currently works only for layers, not for variables

2. Make sure you've selected the correct layer types to rename

3. If you need to undo changes, use the "Revert" button

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes donâ€™t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to codeâ€”no developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? Thatâ€™s Bitovi!

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

plugins.description:
Introduction:

The DT Component Selector plugin is a Figma tool designed to quickly filter and locate DT components in your design. This plugin helps designers improve their workflow by efficiently identifying and managing DT components in complex layouts.


Function Description:

  1. Filters all components in the selected frame that match the DT component criteria.
  2. Categorizes components into those visible on the canvas and those outside the visible bounds.
  3. Supports quick location of selected components for further manipulation.


How to Use:

  1. Select a frame and click the "Show Component Filter" button.
  2. The plugin will automatically filter the qualifying DT components, displaying the results as visible and non-visible components.
  3. Click the "Locate" button next to a component to quickly locate it in your design.


Notes:

  1. The plugin filters only DT components that match predefined criteria, ignoring other types.
  2. Make sure to select a frame for the plugin to function correctly.

As cores das tags sÃ£o personalizÃ¡veis?

O plugin funciona com componentes do Figma?

plugins.name: ArcTouch Flutter Theme Generator

Automatically creates a TextStyleTheme class based on all text styles in your Figma project. This class extends ThemeExtension, allowing seamless integration into your Flutter theme.


Generate Theme

Generates a ColorTheme for each variable collection in your project. Each collection is converted into a ThemeExtension to be used within your Flutter theme. If multiple collections lead to class name conflicts, you can easily rename them in your project.


Generate Color Styles

Creates a const class containing color definitions. This is ideal for projects without design tokens or those that donâ€™t require color variations, providing simple, static color constants.

Creates const classes for design tokens such as spacings, paddings, and borders.

plugins.name: Time2Frame
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that lets you analyze, adjust, and visualize animation settings in real-timeâ€”enhancing precision and efficiency in motion design.


How It Works:


1. Animation Data Extraction

Instantly retrieve animation properties from selected frames, including:

  1. Animation Type: Move In, Fade, Smart Animate, and more.
  2. Direction: Left, Right, Top, Bottom.
  3. Easing Curve: Ease In, Ease Out, Linear, Custom Spring.
  4. Timing Details: Delay and duration (in milliseconds).

Effortlessly gain insights into how animations behave within your prototypes.


2. Frame Rate Conversion

Easily convert animation timing into frame counts based on industry-standard frame rates:

  1. 24 FPS
  2. 30 FPS
  3. 60 FPS

The plugin automatically recalculates delays and durations into frames, ensuring precise control over motion timing.


3. Real-Time Input Adjustments

Modify Delay and Duration values directly in the plugin and see instant updates in:

  1. Milliseconds (for precise timing).
  2. Frames (for seamless animation alignment across FPS settings).

No need for manual calculationsâ€”Time2Frame does it all for you.


4. Animation Preview

Visualize how your animation moves, scales, and fades with an interactive preview. The preview dynamically adjusts to reflect extracted animation properties, allowing designers to fine-tune their animations with confidence.


5. Custom Spring Curve Calculation & Visualization

If a Custom Spring easing is detected, Time2Frame breaks it down into:

  1. Stiffness
  2. Damping
  3. Mass

The plugin generates a real-time graph that illustrates the spring curve, making it easy to refine complex motion dynamics.


Key Features:


  1. Animation Data Extraction â€“ Retrieve animation type, easing, and timing in seconds.
  2. Frame Rate Conversion â€“ Automatically convert timing into frames for 24, 30, or 60 FPS.
  3. Instant Adjustments â€“ Modify animation values with real-time updates.
  4. Live Animation Preview â€“ See how animations behave with accurate visual feedback.
  5. Custom Spring Analysis â€“ Break down spring physics and visualize easing curves.
  6. Smart UI Integration â€“ Works seamlessly with Figmaâ€™s native environment.


Who Is It For?


Time2Frame is built for motion designers, UX/UI designers, and developers who need precise animation breakdowns and real-time adjustments in Figma. Whether youâ€™re fine-tuning micro-interactions or optimizing complex motion flows, this plugin streamlines your workflow and improves animation predictability across different frame rates.
plugins.tagline: Designed for motion designersâ€”select a frame, instantly analyze its animation settings in real time.

The plugin will identify unnecessary layers, transfer their styles, and delete them, making the structure of your layout more readable and organized.
120428.tagline: Removes unnecessary layers from the structure

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

plugins.name: Adapture by INKR
plugins.description:
Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new marketsâ€”right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixesâ€”just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether youâ€™re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.
  2. Cultural Customization: Adapt for new markets with sensitivity to language, tone, and local nuances.
  3. Built for Designers: Works right inside Figma, so you can adapt and update designs without disrupting your workflow.
  4. Seamless Integration: Keeps your layouts clean and intact, saving you time and effort.


Perfect For:


  1. Designers creating multilingual or culturally tailored content.
  2. Teams expanding into new markets or working across global audiences.
  3. Anyone who wants to streamline design adaptation without sacrificing quality.


----

Currently in Closed Beta


Adapture is available in closed beta. You can request an invitation code directly from the plugin to start adapting your designs today.
plugins.tagline: Make Your Designs Work for Any Audience
